## Classes() function

Prefixes a css classes getter keys with a given prefix and adds a css class to its body. supports transforming object keys for conventional class names.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export declare function Classes(prefix?: string, infix?: string, converter?: TFunction<string, [string, boolean]>): <T>(target: any, key: string, desc: CalculatedPropertyDescriptor<ClassesGetter<T>>) => void;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  prefix | <code>string</code> | The class prefix to prefix object keys with. If none is given, it will default to the converted class name. |
|  infix | <code>string</code> | The infix to insert between prefix and key. By default this will be an empty string. |
|  converter | <code>TFunction&lt;string, [string, boolean]&gt;</code> | The converter used to convert object keys with. By default it does nothing. |

<b>Returns:</b>

`<T>(target: any, key: string, desc: CalculatedPropertyDescriptor<ClassesGetter<T>>) => void`

## Remarks

This Decorator should be used on class getters. There are various favors of this decorator preconfigured for certain styles: [ClassesCamel()](./vue-extra-decorators.classescamel.md) [ClassesKebap()](./vue-extra-decorators.classeskebap.md) [ClassesPascal()](./vue-extra-decorators.classespascal.md) [ClassesSnake()](./vue-extra-decorators.classessnake.md)

## Example


```TS
const lower = (str: string) => str.toLowerCase();
@Component({ template: `<div :class="classes">Hello World</div>` })
class MyVueComponent extends Vue {
  @Classes("my-prefix", "--", lower)
  private get classes() {
    return {
      alignLeft: true,
      alignRight: false
    }
  }
}

```
Renders:

```HTML
<div class="my-prefix my-prefix--alignleft">Hello World</div>

```
